testsuite.name: GuessAnimalTest

testcase.name: start

failure.message:
java.lang.AssertionError: Wrong answer in test #2
The average depth should be 3 Expected matches: "(?is).*average[^\\R]*3.*" Actual data is: "The Knowledge Tree stats
- root node - It is a mammal. - total number of nodes 11 - total number of animals 6 - total number of statements 5 - height of the tree 2147483647 - minimum animal's depth -2147483648 - average animal's depth 2.4
Welcome to the animal expert system
1. Play the guessing game 2. List of all animals 3. Search for an animal 4. Calculate statistics 5. Print the Knowledge Tree 0. Exit".
Please find below the output of your program during this failed test. Note that the '>' character indicates the beginning of the input line.
---
I want to learn about animals. Which animal do you like most? > cat
Welcome to the animal expert system
1. Play the guessing game 2. List of all animals 3. Search for an animal 4. Calculate statistics 5. Print the Knowledge Tree 0. Exit > 1 Let's play a game! Press enter when you're ready. You think of an animal, and I guess it. > Is it a cat? > no I give up. What animal do you have in mind? > shark Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a shark. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... > it is a mammal Specify a fact that distinguishes a cat from a shark. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... Is the statement correct for a shark? > no I learned the following facts about animals: - The shark isn't a mammal. - The cat is a mammal. I can distinguish these animals by asking the question: - Is it a mammal?
Would you like to play again? > yes You think of an animal, and I guess it. press enter > - Is it a mammal? > yes Is it a cat? I win!1 > no I give up. What animal do you have in mind? > fox Specify a fact that distinguishes a fox from a cat. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... > it is living in the forest Is the statement correct for a fox? > yes would you like to play again > yes You think of an animal, and I guess it. press enter > - Is it a mammal? > yes - Is it living in the forest? > no Is it a cat? I win!1 > no I give up. What animal do you have in mind? > dog Specify a fact that distinguishes a dog from a cat. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... > it can climb trees Is the statement correct for a dog? > no would you like to play again > yes You think of an animal, and I guess it. press enter > - Is it a mammal? > yes - Is it living in the forest? > yes Is it a fox? I win!1 > no I give up. What animal do you have in mind? > wolf Specify a fact that distinguishes a wolf from a fox. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... > it has a long bushy tail Is the statement correct for a wolf? > no would you like to play again > yes You think of an animal, and I guess it. press enter > - Is it a mammal? > yes - Is it living in the forest? > yes - Does it have a long bushy tail? > no Is it a wolf? I win!1 > no I give up. What animal do you have in mind? > hare Specify a fact that distinguishes a hare from a wolf. The sentence should satisfy one of the following templates: - It can ... - It has ... - It is a/an ... > it is a shy animal Is the statement correct for a hare? > yes would you like to play again > no

1. Play the guessing game 2. List of all animals 3. Search for an animal 4. Calculate statistics 5. Print the Knowledge Tree 0. Exit > 2 Here are the animals I know: cat dog fox hare shark wolf
